description.content: An ally in range 4 is cured.
At the start of the round, this character may clear a status or mark.

The Apex creates a small blast area of dangerous terrain (which the Apex ignores) in free space in range. Foes inside the area are blinded+. If the Apex uses this ability again, it can either create a new cloud, or blow its existing clouds 2 spaces in any direction, which could cause them to overlap characters. It can have up to 2 clouds at once. Clouds last indefinitely, but evaporate if this ability is weakened.

The Apex gains 10 vigor as its armor hardens. The next time it takes damage from a foe’s ability, the armor explodes, ending all vigor, and dazing and dealing 4 piercing damage to all foes in range 2 as an area effect.

The Apex impales a character in range with a barb. While this effect is active, they take 1 piercing damage for each space they move, dash, or are shoved. The effect can be removed if a character doesn’t move for their entire turn, or if they are cured.
The Apex rushes 3, then shoves an adjacent foe 2 spaces.

subcontent.content: Foe takes fray damage twice and is slashed.

description.content: A foe in range takes 3 damage and is shoved 1, then create a height 1 boulder object next to them.

The Apex chooses a foe in range that has not acted yet. At the end of that foe’s turn, a geyser erupts under them, dealing fray damage and inflicting weakened as a medium blast area effect centered on them. Weakened foes take [D]+fray instead.

The Apex disappears from sight, removing itself from the battlefield. It then re-appears adjacent to any player character in range 3, placing it in free adjacent space. They must save or take 2 damage, four times and be dazed, or just 2 damage, twice on a successful save.

The Apex soars into the air, removing it from the battlefield, then returns with at least one space in range 2. When it takes off, it can pick up an adjacent foe, dealing fray damage and forcing them to save. On a failed save, they are removed with the Apex, then placed adjacent after it lands. On a successful save, they are shoved 1.
The Apex sweeps their tail in an arc 4 area effect. Foes inside take 2 damage and are all shoved 2 in a direction of the Apex’s choice.

The Apex digs up some stashed carrion and eats it. Create a pit in an adjacent space. During their next turn, all their abilities deal bonus damage and their attacks gain +1 boon and may critical hit (+[D]).

The Apex releases a shriek, affecting all foes in range as an area effect. Foes take 2 damage, once, for each space between them and the Apex (so foes at range 2 would take 2 damage, twice etc). If the Apex is inside a Hunting Ground, this effect increases to range 3.

The Apex releases a blast of ice, fire, sand, or some other element, creating a medium blast area effect. Foes inside take 2 damage, then must save or be shoved 2 and blinded, or just shoved 1 on a successful save. Then create up to two dangerous terrain pit spaces in the area (fire, water, quicksand, etc).
An adjacent foe is shoved 1. If they’re bloody, they are instead shoved 3.

Fixer marks an adjacent foe. While marked, that foe must save if it attempts to break adjacency the first time in a round. On a failed save, it becomes unable to exit adjacency with Fixer by any means for the rest of the current round. On a successful save, the mark and this effect ends, but the foe is weakened.
Teleport 3, then may deal 2 damage to an adjacent foe. Bloodied foes take 2 damage twice.
foe in range 3 is sealed, then must save or swap places with Sharkie, teleporting. Bloodied characters fail the save.

subcontent.content: [D] + fray and the foe is shattered
A different foe in range 3 from the original target takes fray damage.
Deals bonus damage agaist bloodied foes.

description.content: Choose a foe in range 6 that has not acted this round. At the end of that foe’s next turn, they explode in a small blast area effect for [D]+fray piercing damage, dealing damage to all foes other than them in the area. Summon a pit under them. If they are standing in a pit when the explosion happens, they are stunned and also take damage.

A foe in range 6 is marked. While marked, abilities against the target gain true strike, and allies gain +1 boon to attack the foe. Using this mark again transfers it. A foe can end this mark by ending their turn more than 2 spaces away from any Brother.
At the start of the round, the Weapon charges up a massive flame cannon. At the end of the round, it fires a searing blast from the cannon.

subcontent.content: Assign each side of the weapon a number, from 1 to 4, then roll 1d4. The weapon blasts a line area effect 2 spaces wide that is exactly lined up with the rolled edge of the weapon and goes the entire battlefield.
Foes inside the explosion are weakened and must save or take 2[D]+fray, or [D]+fray on a successful save. This damage cannot reduce a character below 1 hp.
The Weapon takes 8 damage if it’s caught inside an explosion.
Then, create a space of burning dangerous terrain under every foe, then 2 more spaces anywhere in the area, even if there were no foes inside.

description.content: The Demon devours and absorbs an adjacent bloodied demon, destroying it permanently and curing itself. They then gain +1 action for all their turns for the rest of combat, starting with this one.

subcontent.content: as a free action, destroying it and giving them +1 action for this turn only. A demon can only use Devour or Devour Natal in the same turn, and not both.
Dash 2, then deal 1 piercing damage to all adjacent foes.
Up to two other Natals may deal 1 piercing damage to an adjacent foe.
Create a difficult terrain space adjacent to up to two natals. This space can be created under characters, and deals 1 piercing damage to a character in the space when it is created.

description.content: A Churner can always spend a free action to roll 1d6 and dash up to that many spaces.
Until the start of their next turn, the Guider increases the distance of any dash, rush, teleport or flight by +3.
This character sacrifices 50% of their max hp but immediately gains +1 action.
Dash 2. This action can interrupt and split up other actions or movement.

The demon chooses a character in range 4 and gains control over their limbs. After that character rolls a d20, the demon can choose to roll its own d20, substituting the demon’s result as the final result. A character can resist this effect by sacrificing 6, also ending this mark.
At the start of each round, the Idol creates one of the following terrain effects (roll 1d6). Manifestations must be created in free spaces. There is no maximum number active.

The head lopper attempts to grab foe of its choice in range. At the of the very next player turn, if that foe is still in range 3, the Head Lopper removes itself from the battlefield, places itself adjacent, then performs one of the following moves, dealing 6 damage and ending this effect:

subcontent.content: The foe is stunned, weakened, slashed, and shoved 1.
The Head Lopper and the foe rush 2 together, then the foe takes piercing fray damage again and has a pit created underneath them.
The foe becomes immobile for their next turn.

description.content: At the start of each round, the Aesi puts down a space of swirling wind, a 1 space terrain effect, adjacent to its space. Characters that enter such a space, including the Aesi, can fly 3 spaces as an effect, but only once a turn. Spaces persist until the end of combat.

At the start of combat, the Aesi creates a Creeping Cold effect in every space along the edge of the map, a creeping black frost terrain effect. The Aesi ignores its effects, but cannot voluntarily enter the area and must end its turn outside it if possible.

subcontent.content: The area is difficult terrain, even for flying characters

Foes that either start or end their turn in Creeping Cold sacrifice 25% of their maximum hp. Foes at 1 hp are defeated instantly, and removed from the battlefield as they freeze solid and replaced with a frozen statue object with 10 hp. When the statue is destroyed, return that foe to the battlefield, in its space, still defeated.

description.content: At the start of every two rounds thereafter (3, 5, 7, etc), the effect creeps in by 1 space on all sides, shrinking the available battlefield space until it covers all spaces.

subcontent.content: All husks may rush 1 space. Then foes adjacent to one or more husks take 2 piercing damage.

description.content: Choose a bloodied character adjacent to one or more husks, then destroy all husks adjacent to that character. If that character is an ally, they gain 2 vigor per husk destroyed. If that character was a foe, they must sacrifice 2 per husk destroyed.

subcontent.content: All foes adjacent to the attack target take fray damage.

description.content: A foe in range 2 is shoved 1 towards the Wight and slashed.
All allies in range may rush 1 towards this character. Bloodied allies that rushed this way gain 3 vigor.
The Wight and all allies in range may rush 1 space in the same direction, then all foes adjacent to any character that moved this way take 2 damage.
The Wight and all allies in range may rush 1 space in the same direction, then all foes adjacent to any character that moved this way take 2 damage.

subcontent.content: Death March becomes a free action if the Wight is bloodied.

description.content: The Wight and all allies in range may rush 1 space in the same direction, then all foes adjacent to any character that moved this way take fray damage.

subcontent.content: Death March becomes a free action if the Wight is bloodied.
Sealed foes must sacrifice 4. Then, attack target is sealed.
Sealed foes must sacrifice 4. Then, attack target is sealed.
Unholy creates a grasping dead terrain effect under up to two of its targets after it resolves, as per

description.content: Mark a foe in range 6. While marked, that foe deals half damage unless adjacent to an ally. If they end their turn adjacent to an ally, they can save to clear this mark.

subcontent.content: Foes take 2 damage. Allies gain 2 vigor. Then, create a difficult terrain effect space of grasping dead hands underneath every foe in the area. While inside a grasping hands space, foes are sealed+ and cannot gain vigor.

description.content: This character becomes immobile but gains Aura 2 until the start of its next turn. While the aura is active, Relict other than this character in the area cannot be reduced past 1 hp.

subcontent.content: Foe take 2 damage again if not adjacent to any allies, and 2 damage again if bloodied.

description.content: The Ghul or a relict in range 2 can teleport 3.

subcontent.content: An adjacent foe sacrifices 3. If they are bloodied, they sacrifice 6 instead, and the Ghul gains evasion until the start of its next turn.
A foe in range sacrifices 3. If they are bloodied, they sacrifice 6 instead, and the Ghul gains evasion until the start of its next turn.
A foe in range sacrifices 3. If they are bloodied, they sacrifice 6 instead, and the Ghul gains evasion until the start of its next turn.
When used against a foe at 25% hp or lower, Life Drain additionally reduces a foe to 1 hp, and the Ghul gains a vigor surge.
A foe in range must save or become blinded+ and gains +1 curse on all attacks and saves until it ends a turn adjacent to an ally, ending this effect. On a successful save, they are only blinded.

description.content: Creates a Soul Spark summon in free space in range.
Creates a Soul Spark summon in free space in range.
Soul Sparks deal 1 piercing damage to all adjacent foes when summoned.
Creates a Soul Spark summon in free space in range.
Soul Sparks deal 1 piercing damage to all adjacent foes when summoned.
Mark a foe in range. At the end of that foe's turn, they take 1 piercing damage, once, for every other character in range 2, then become vulnerable. Then, this mark ends.

subcontent.content: Shove 1. If the beast or target is bloodied increase this shove to 3.

description.content: The beast hurls an adjacent ally, removing them from the battlefield, then placing them in range 3. That ally deals 2 damage to adjacent foes when landing.
The beast hurls an adjacent ally or foe, removing them from the battlefield, then placing them in range 3. That character deals 2 damage to adjacent foes when landing.

The beast hurls an adjacent ally or foe, removing them from the battlefield, then placing them in range 5. That character deals 2 damage to adjacent foes when landing. If the beast is bloodied the target also takes 3 damage.
The beast chooses a foe in range and becomes sturdy.
At the end of that foe’s next turn, the beast rushes up to 4, with each space moving towards that foe, phasing through characters.
Characters the beast passes through are shoved 1 to either side and take 2 damage.
If the beasts ends this movement adjacent to their foe, that foe is weakened and must save or take 2[D]+fray and become stunned, or [D]+fray on a successful save. Then, this effect ends.

The lizard gathers momentum, then rolls 4 spaces in a straight line, or as far as possible, rushing. After it stops moving, it deals damage to all adjacent foes equal to the spaces it rushed, then shoves them 1.

subcontent.content: Beast may dash 2 before making the attack.
If made from stealth, deals bonus damage and dazes its target.
Beast may fly 2 before making the attack.
If made from stealth, deals bonus damage and dazes its target.
Beast may fly 2 before making the attack.
If made from stealth, deals bonus damage and dazes its target.
Ambush can critically hit (+[D]) when this beast is bloodied.

description.content: The Stalking beast marks a foe in range. While marked, at the end of that foe’s turn, the beast can remove itself from the battlefield, then return in any adjacent space to them. If the marked foe is not adjacent to any allies, the beast deals 6 damage to them, then gains stealth.
Foes in the area take 2 damage. The Stalking Beast may dash to any space in the area after this action resolves, with phasing.
A foe in range is pacified, then shoved either 1 space towards or away from the Symbiote.
The character the symbiote is latched on to dashes 3 and may deal 2 damage to an adjacent character of the symbiote’s choice.
The Symbiote’s host becomes sturdy, gains 5 vigor, and gains +1 action. These effects last until the end of the host’s next turn.

subcontent.content: At round 3+, deals bonus damage and increase effect area to a large blast.

description.content: The beast flies 2, then deals 2 piercing damage to a foe in range 6.
The Beast creates a small blast area of difficult terrain in range. Characters in the area when it is created take 3 piercing damage as an area effect, and characters inside the area are vulnerable+
The Beast creates a small blast area of difficult terrain in range. Characters in the area when it is created take 3 piercing damage as an area effect, and characters inside the area are vulnerable+

subcontent.content: If they collide with a foe, that foe is weakened and shoved 1, and that ally gains 3 vigor.

description.content: Rush 1, then an adjacent character takes 2 damage and is shoved 1.

subcontent.content: They are slashed, take 2 damage, and are shoved 1 again.

description.content: Rush 1, then an adjacent character takes 2 damage and is shoved 1.

subcontent.content: They are slashed, take 2 damage, and are shoved 1 again.

description.content: Rush 1, then an adjacent character takes 2 damage and is shoved 1.

subcontent.content: They are slashed, take 2 damage, and are shoved 1 again.
When bloodied, Uppercut becomes a free action.
Uppercut deals +1 more damage per valuables token the Scrapper is holding.

description.content: Rush 2, then an adjacent foe must save or take [D]+fray and become stunned, or just fray damage on a successful save.

subcontent.content: May dash 1 both before and after attack.

description.content: An adjacent foe is dazed. If they have a valuables token, that foe takes 3 damage, then the looter gains a valuables token.

subcontent.content: Deal 2 damage again to each character for each valuables token the Looter has.

description.content: Create a small blast area of difficult terrain in range, then the Looter gains stealth. The area can overlap characters. Self and allies in the area gain evasion+, and foes inside are blinded+.
Create a small blast area of difficult terrain in range, then the Looter gains stealth. The area can overlap characters. Self and allies in the area gain evasion+, and foes inside are blinded+.

subcontent.content: Increase the blast size to medium.

description.content: Create a small blast area of difficult terrain in range, then the Looter gains stealth. When created, all foes in the area take 3 damage and are dazed. The area can overlap characters. Self and allies in the area gain evasion+, and foes inside are blinded+.

subcontent.content: Increase the blast size to medium.
All allies in range 2 of the target foe may dash 1.

description.content: Swap places with a character in range, removing and placing both characters. Foes can pass a save to avoid this effect, but are pacified on a successful save.
Swap places with a character in range, removing and placing both characters. Foes can pass a save to avoid this effect, but are pacified on a successful save.
Swap places with a character in range, removing and placing both characters. Foes can pass a save to avoid this effect, but are pacified on a successful save.

subcontent.content: Swindle has no maximum range. Allies that are swapped with Swindle gain stealth.

description.content: The broker either puts down a valuables token in range, or allows an ally in range 3 to dash 3.

A foe in range is marked. At the end of their turn, that foe must sacrifice 3. They can avoid paying this cost if they drop a valuables token into an adjacent space. They both avoid the cost and end this mark by dropping two or more valuables tokens instead.

subcontent.content: Deals bonus damage, becomes a large blast, and also creates a valuables token in its area.

description.content: The Tinker summons a scrap turret in range.

The Junker creates a height 1 scrap pile object in a space in range 6. Characters adjacent to it when it is created takes 1 damage twice and are shoved 1. If created under a character, it pushes them up on top of it instead.

subcontent.content: Increase damage, height and shove by +1.

description.content: The Junker creates a height 1 scrap pile object in a space in range 6. Characters adjacent to it when it is created takes 1 damage twice and are shoved 1. If created under a character, it pushes them up on top of it instead.

subcontent.content: Increase damage, height and shove by +1. Adjacent foes must save or be shattered.

description.content: The Junker creates a height 1 scrap pile object in a space in range 6. Characters adjacent to it when it is created takes 1 damage twice and are shoved 1. If created under a character, it pushes them up on top of it instead.

subcontent.content: Increase damage, height and shove by +1. Adjacent foes must save or be shattered.
Pile it up gains +1 damage, height, and shove per valuables token the hoarder has, to a maximum of 3 height, +3 damage, and +3 shove.

description.content: The Hob swaps places with an adjacent character, removing and placing both characters.
The acting Sprigg swaps places with an ally in range 3, removing and placing both characters.
The acting Sprigg swaps the places of two other characters in range 2 of the Sprigg, removing and placing both of them.
The hob chooses itself or an ally in range, marking them.
When marked, that character gains 3 vigor, and while marked, that character is immune to all shove, teleport, and remove from the battlefield effects from foes.
This mark ends if the marked character moves, but does not end if its allies move them.
A foe in range is slashed, then marked.
While marked, each time that foe is shoved, teleported, or removed and placed on the battlefield, they take 2 damage.
A foe can end this mark by not moving for their entire turn.

subcontent.content: It’s next turn must be slow.

description.content: At the start of that turn, all adjacent foes must save or take 2[D]+fray and be shoved 1, or [D]+fray on a successful save.

subcontent.content: It’s next turn must be slow.

description.content: At the start of that turn, all adjacent foes must save or take 2[D]+fray and be shoved 1, or [D]+fray on a successful save. This deals bonus damage for each object caught in the area.

subcontent.content: It’s next turn must be slow.

description.content: At the start of that turn, all foes in range 2 must save or take 2[D]+fray and be shoved 1, or [D]+fray on a successful save. This deals bonus damage for each object caught in the area.
A foe in range becomes vulnerable, then is teleported 1.
A character in range becomes vulnerable, then is teleported 1. If the character is an ally, they are instead teleported 2 and not made vulnerable.
A character in range becomes vulnerable, then is teleported 1. If the character is an ally, they are instead teleported 2 and not made vulnerable.
A character in range of the spirit is marked.
While marked, each time they teleport, they take 1 piercing damage. This damage cannot reduce them past 1 hp.
A foe can end this mark by not moving for their entire turn.
The spirit hob ends its turn and chooses a terrain space in range 6.

subcontent.content: It’s next turn must be slow.

description.content: At the start of that turn, the space explodes, releasing a massive blast of sonic energy in a medium blast area effect centered on it. Foes inside are teleported 2 spaces, shattered, then must save or take [D]+fray twice, or once on a successful save.

subcontent.content: Deals 3 damage again its target if they are marked.

description.content: The hob may dash up to 2, then foe in range is dazed.

subcontent.content: A foe in range 3 uses an ability and the ability resolves.
The foe loses the memory of that ability, becoming unable to use it again until the end of their next turn. Any passive effects of the ability for that duration still continue as normal.
A foe in range 6 uses an ability and the ability resolves.
The foe loses the memory of that ability, becoming unable to use it again until the end of their next turn. Any passive effects of the ability for that duration still continue as normal.

It’s next turn must be slow.

description.content: At the start of that turn, it teleports 3, then deals 3 damage to an adjacent foe. Can repeat this effect, but must choose a different foe in range each time unless a foe has already been chosen by this ability, or this effect has triggered three times.

subcontent.content: The Hob inflicts a status it is currently suffering from on its foe, then deals 2 damage, once, per status its foe is afflicted by.
The Hob inflicts a status it is currently suffering from on its foe, then deals 2 damage, once, per status or mark its foe is afflicted by.
The Hob inflicts a status it is currently suffering from on its foe, then deals 2 damage, once, per status or mark its foe is afflicted by.
If the hob or its target is bloodied, The Old Magic also may end all statuses affecting the hob after transferring them.

description.content: The Hob marks any two characters in range.
While marked, if a marked character ends their turn in range 3 of their marked partner, they are both pacified and gain 3 vigor.
A foe in range is sealed.
Sealed foes are shoved 2 in any direction.
The Hob gains the following interrupt until the start of its next turn:

subcontent.content: A character in range 3 of the Hob gains a status.
The Hob transfers the status to itself or an ally in range 3 of the Hob. If it removed a status from an ally, that ally gains 2 vigor.
Deals 2 damage again to attack target and the Jotunn gains 2 vigor if the foe is affected by a status. If that foe is affected by 3 or more statuses, increase damage and vigor gain to 5.

description.content: A foe in range must save or gain hatred of the Jotunn. On a successful save, they are weakened.
If the target or Jotunn is bloodied, they gain +1 curse on this save.

Swap places with an ally in range, removing and placing both characters.
Fly up to 4 spaces in a straight line.
One adjacent foe when the elemental either starts or ends this flight is dazed.

All foes are teleported 1. Bloodied characters are teleported 2 and blinded instead.

Create a 1 space elemental mote terrain effect in its area. While at least partly inside the area effect, elementals have evasion and stealth+.
The Elemental creates an elemental storm in range, a 1 space terrain effect.
Elementals have evasion and permanent stealth inside the area. The area is dangerous terrain for all other characters and other characters are blinded+ while in the area.
At the end of the round, all storms grow to a small blast area, or a large blast area if they are a small blast.

description.content: Up to two storms can be active at once.

description.content: Swap places with a character in range, teleporting both characters.

An ally in range is marked and may dash 3. When marked, they gain +2 speed, they gain defiance, and while marked they gain increased from noxious cloud

subcontent.content: Deals bonus damage for each character in the area. If 3 or more characters are in the area, all foes in the area take 2 piercing damage and are shattered.

description.content: A foe in range either becomes vulnerable or takes 1 piercing damage, twice.
An ally or allied summon in range may fly 3.
The Apiarist summons an attack insect in range 3. It may have a maximum of two insects at once.
